txt.en: Chasing Rumours

'I share with you now what it is that brought me to the Wildwood. Far have I travelled to come here, hoom, following tales that reached my forest of walking trees. Though it is a desperate hope, if there is any chance of finding the lost Entwives, then try I must, hummm, hoom. You are of a mind to move much more quickly than I. Perhaps you could search for signs of the Entwives.'

'I share with you now what it is that brought me to the Wildwood. Far have I travelled to come here, hoom, following tales that reached my forest of walking trees. Though it is a desperate hope, if there is any chance of finding the lost Entwives, then try I must, hummm, hoom. You are of a mind to move much more quickly than I. Talk to Thornmane
Search the eastern Wildwood
Assist Thornmane in the Wildwood
There are no traces of Entwives here
Search the central Wildwood
Orcs and brigands, but no signs of Entwives
Search the northern Wildwood
No Entwives walk here, only Huorns
Search the southern Wildwood
Search the western Wildwood
Thornmane believes signs of the Entwives may be found across the Wildwood.\n\nSearch the Wildwood for signs of the Entwives.
Thornmane has travelled far, chasing after rumours of walking trees in the Wildwood.
There are no traces of Entwives here
Thornmane can be found in the Wildwood.\n\nYou should talk to Thornmane.
There are no traces of Entwives here
Orcs and brigands, but no signs of Entwives
No Entwives walk here, only Huorns
Search the eastern Wildwood
'Would it not be incredible, were we to find the lost Entwives?'
Search the central Wildwood
No Entwives here. Only the Wicked Holm
Search the southern Wildwood
Investigate the Rumors of Walking Trees in the Wildwood

'So the tales spoke only of Huorns, as I suspected, hoom. No doubt they were roused to action by the deeds of the Orcs, huummm, though those you found in the southern Wildwood seem long twisted.\n\n'Saddened though I am that no trace of the Entwives was found, I expected as much.'

'I share with you now what it is that brought me to the Wildwood. Far have I travelled to come here, hoom, following tales that reached my forest of walking trees. Though it is a desperate hope, if there is any chance of finding the lost Entwives, then try I must, hummm, hoom. You are of a mind to move much more quickly than I. Perhaps you could search for signs of the Entwives.'
There are no traces of Entwives here
